Uses of Class
com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha.VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder

  • Packages that use VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder 
    Package Description
    com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha
    The com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha package provides interfaces to manage the vCenter Server Inventory Cluster HA settings.

    • Uses of VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder in com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha

      Methods in com.vmware.appliance.vcenter.settings.v1.config.components.inventory.cluster.ha that return VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder.setClusterSettings(java.lang.Boolean clusterSettings)
      Flag indicating whether to use the cluster settings or the per VM settings.
      VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder.setEnabled(java.lang.Boolean enabled)
      Flag indicating whether or not the Virtual Machine Health Monitoring service is enabled.
      VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder.setFailureInterval(java.lang.Long failureInterval)
      If no heartbeat has been received for at least the specified number of seconds, the virtual machine is declared as failed.
      VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder.setMaxFailures(java.lang.Long maxFailures)
      Maximum number of failures and automated resets allowed during the time that VmToolsMonitoringSettings.getMaxFailureWindow() specifies.
      VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder.setMaxFailureWindow(java.lang.Long maxFailureWindow)
      The number of seconds for the window during which up to VmToolsMonitoringSettings.getMaxFailures() resets can occur before automated responses stop.
      VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder VmToolsMonitoringSettings.Builder.setMinUpTime(java.lang.Long minUpTime)
      The number of seconds for the virtual machine's heartbeats to stabilize after the virtual machine has been powered on.
